Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs

mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility





Introduction

The MIDAS Web Server utility mhttpd provides MIDAS DAQ control through the web using any web browser. Provided the daemon application is running, the user may access any MIDAS experiment running on a given host from a Web browser.

Full monitoring and almost full control of a particular experiment can be achieved through the MIDAS Web server.

  • The mhttpd daemon
  • Features of mhttpd
    • list of mhttpd pages
    • list of mhttpd-specific odb trees

Features of mhttpd

The basic functionality of mhttpd includes:

  • Run control (start/stop/pause).
  • Up-to-date client status and statistics display (frontend(s) logger(s) etc.)
  • Graphical history data display.
  • Electronic LogBook recording/retrieval messages
  • Alarm monitoring/control
  • Slow control data display.
  • Listing of currently connected clients
  • Basic access to ODB.

These functions are available on one or more of the various mhttpd pages described below :

  • Main Status Page : monitoring, statistics display, access to other pages etc.
  • Start page : Run control page
  • ODB page : Online Database manipulation ( an alternative to using odbedit )
  • Equipment page : Frontend information
  • Slow Control page : Slow Control information
  • Message page : Message Log
  • Elog page : Electronic Log
  • Programs page : Program control (clients)
  • History page : History display
  • Alarm page : Alarm system control
  • MSCB page MIDAS Slow Control Bus
  • CAMAC Access page : CAMAC access
  • mhttpd Alias page : user defined Alias page(s)
  • mhttpd Logger page : data logger settings information
  • Config page : status page update period
  • Custom pages : user defined Web page(s)

Several directory trees in the ODB are specific to mhttpd, or have additional features if mhttpd is running. They are described below in the appropriate section.

  • The ODB /Alias Tree
  • The /Custom ODB tree
  • The ODB /Script tree
  • The ODB /Elog Tree
  • Defining Edit-on-start Parameters
